items.title: Netflix-Warner Bros $82.7 Billion Mega-Merger Sparks Fierce Hollywood, Lawmakers Backlash— Elizabeth Warren Calls It An 'Anti-Monopoly Nightmare'
items.standfirst: The reaction to Netflix Inc.'s (NASDAQ:NFLX) $82.7 billion plan to acquire Warner Bros. Discovery, Inc. (NASDAQ:WBD) erupted across Washington and Hollywood on Friday, with lawmakers, unions, producers, and industry veterans warning the merger could reshape — and possibly destabilize — the…

(NASDAQ:WBD) erupted across Washington and Hollywood on Friday, with lawmakers, unions, producers, and industry veterans warning the merger could reshape — and possibly destabilize — the…

items.title: How Netflix won Warner Bros. Discovery, Hollywood's biggest prize
items.standfirst: What started as a fact-finding mission for Netflix culminated in one of the biggest media deals in the last decade and one that stands to reshape the global entertainment business landscape. Netflix announced on Friday it had reached a deal to buy Warner Bros. Discovery's TV, film and streaming…

items.title: How Netflix won Hollywood's biggest prize, Warner Bros Discovery
Netflix to buy Warner Bros. in a deal valued at $82.7 billion
items.standfirst: Netflix on Friday said it will acquire Warner Bros., including its film and television studios, HBO Max and HBO.
items.content: Netflix on Friday said it will acquire Warner Bros., including its film and television studios, HBO Max and HBO.

items.title: What Netflix's $82.7 billion deal to buy Warner Bros. means for viewers
items.standfirst: Netflix said it is buying Warner Bros. in a deal valued at $82.7 billion, merging the biggest streaming service with a storied studio that has produced films such as "Casablanca" and the "Harry Potter" franchise. Elaine Quijano has more on what it means for those watching at home.
items.content: Netflix said it is buying Warner Bros. in a deal valued at $82.7 billion, merging the biggest streaming service with a storied studio that has produced films such as "Casablanca" and the "Harry Potter" franchise. Elaine Quijano has more on what it means for those watching at home.

items.title: What Netflix’s deal to buy Warner Bros. means for one of Hollywood’s oldest studios
items.standfirst: Netflix has struck a nearly $83 billion deal to acquire Warner Bros. and HBO Max, beating out Paramount and Comcast after a bidding war. If finalized, it would unite the world’s largest streamer with one of Hollywood’s oldest studios. The move raises questions about the future of theatrical…
items.content: Netflix has struck a nearly $83 billion deal to acquire Warner Bros. and HBO Max, beating out Paramount and Comcast after a bidding war. If finalized, it would unite the world’s largest streamer with one of Hollywood’s oldest studios. The move raises questions about the future of theatrical…

items.title: How the Netflix-Warner Bros. Deal Changes Hollywood
items.standfirst: Netflix Inc. has agreed to purchase the streaming and studio assets of Warner Bros. Discovery Inc. in a $72 billion deal that’s likely to impact the entertainment industry for decades.
items.content: Netflix Inc. has agreed to purchase the streaming and studio assets of Warner Bros. Discovery Inc. in a $72 billion deal that’s likely to impact the entertainment industry for decades.

items.title: Netflix to buy Warner Bros film and streaming businesses for $72bn
items.standfirst: The major Hollywood deal means Netflix will takeover ownership of franchises including Harry Potter and Game of Thrones.

items.title: Netflix to Buy Warner Bros. in $72 Billion Cash, Stock Deal | Bloomberg Tech 12/5/2025
items.standfirst: Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow discuss Netflix’s agreement to buy Warner Bros. Discovery after it completes the planned spinoff of its cable channels. Plus, the European Union Ambassador to the US responds to criticism of the $140 million fine the bloc has levied on Elon Musk’s social media platform X. And HPE CEO, Antonio Neri, discusses the company’s outlook after reporting disappointing 4Q AI server sales. (Source: Bloomberg)
items.content: Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow discuss Netflix’s agreement to buy Warner Bros. Discovery after it completes the planned spinoff of its cable channels. Plus, the European Union Ambassador to the US responds to criticism of the $140 million fine the bloc has levied on Elon Musk’s social media platform X. And HPE CEO, Antonio Neri, discusses the company’s outlook after reporting disappointing 4Q AI server sales. (Source: Bloomberg)

items.title: HPE’s AI Servers Ready as Soon Data Centers Are, Says CEO
items.standfirst: HPE CEO Antonio Neri discusses the company’s earnings as its sales for AI servers fall short. He joins Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Tech”. (Source: Bloomberg)
items.content: HPE CEO Antonio Neri discusses the company’s earnings as its sales for AI servers fall short. He joins Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Tech”. (Source: Bloomberg)

items.title: Netflix, Warner Bros. Face Road to Finalizing Deal
items.standfirst: Finalizing the deal between Netflix and Warner Bros. Discovery will be a longer and bigger fight than Game of Thrones, says Jon Klein, co-founder of Hang Media. The former head of CNN discusses the challenges facing the tie-up and the competition Netflix faces from YouTube and the creator economy. He speaks with Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on "Bloomberg Tech." (Source: Bloomberg)
items.content: Finalizing the deal between Netflix and Warner Bros. Discovery will be a longer and bigger fight than Game of Thrones, says Jon Klein, co-founder of Hang Media. The former head of CNN discusses the challenges facing the tie-up and the competition Netflix faces from YouTube and the creator economy. He speaks with Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on "Bloomberg Tech." (Source: Bloomberg)

items.title: Netflix Breaks From ‘Build, Not Buy’ With Warner Bros. Deal
items.standfirst: Netflix agrees to buy Warner Bros. Discovery in a historic $72 billion cash and stock deal. Bloomberg’s Lucas Shaw discusses the combination of the world’s dominant paid streaming service with one of Hollywood’s oldest and most revered studios. He joins Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Tech.” (Source: Bloomberg)
items.content: Netflix agrees to buy Warner Bros. Discovery in a historic $72 billion cash and stock deal. Bloomberg’s Lucas Shaw discusses the combination of the world’s dominant paid streaming service with one of Hollywood’s oldest and most revered studios. He joins Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Tech.” (Source: Bloomberg)

items.title: Netflix–Warner Bros. Deal Sets Up $72 Billion Antitrust Test
items.standfirst: Netflix Inc. has won the heated takeover battle for Warner Bros. Discovery Inc. Now it must convince global antitrust regulators that the deal won’t give it an illegal advantage in the streaming market.
items.content: Netflix Inc. has won the heated takeover battle for Warner Bros. Discovery Inc. Now it must convince global antitrust regulators that the deal won’t give it an illegal advantage in the streaming market.

items.title: ‘This merger must be blocked’: Netflix-Warner Bros deal faces fierce backlash
items.standfirst: US politicians and Hollywood guilds have voiced concerns against the proposed $83bn purchase of the studioThe news that Netflix has agreed to buy Warner Bros in an $83bn deal has led to backlash among figures in and out of the entertainment industry.Elizabeth Warren, a Democratic senator, called it “an anti-monopoly nightmare” in a statement released soon after the announcement. Continue reading...
items.content: US politicians and Hollywood guilds have voiced concerns against the proposed $83bn purchase of the studioThe news that Netflix has agreed to buy Warner Bros in an $83bn deal has led to backlash among figures in and out of the entertainment industry.Elizabeth Warren, a Democratic senator, called it “an anti-monopoly nightmare” in a statement released soon after the announcement. items.title: EU Can Regulate Tech, Bloc's US Ambassador Says
items.standfirst: European Union Ambassador to the US Jovita Neliupšienė talks about why bloc fined Elon Musk's X social network €120 million ($140 million) for violating a content-moderation law. She says the European Commission doesn’t target any one country or company with its rules. She discusses the EU’s approach to tech, defense, and the use of frozen Russian funds to support Ukraine's war effort. She joins Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on "Bloomberg Tech." (Source: Bloomberg)
items.content: European Union Ambassador to the US Jovita Neliupšienė talks about why bloc fined Elon Musk's X social network €120 million ($140 million) for violating a content-moderation law. She says the European Commission doesn’t target any one country or company with its rules. She discusses the EU’s approach to tech, defense, and the use of frozen Russian funds to support Ukraine's war effort. She joins Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on "Bloomberg Tech." (Source: Bloomberg)

items.title: Netflix to acquire Warner Bros studio, HBO Max for $72 billion
items.standfirst: Streaming giant Netflix has agreed to acquire Warner Bros studios and its streaming business for $72 billion, the two American companies announced in a statement on Friday. This acquisition would bring two of the industry’s biggest players in film and TV under one roof.
items.content: Streaming giant Netflix has agreed to acquire Warner Bros studios and its streaming business for $72 billion, the two American companies announced in a statement on Friday. This acquisition would bring two of the industry’s biggest players in film and TV under one roof.

items.title: Netflix to Buy Warner Bros. in Historic $72 Billion Deal
items.standfirst: Netflix Inc. agreed to buy Warner Bros. Discovery Inc., marking a seismic shift in the entertainment business as a Silicon Valley-bred streaming giant tries to swallow one of Hollywood’s oldest and most revered studios.
items.content: Netflix Inc. agreed to buy Warner Bros. Discovery Inc., marking a seismic shift in the entertainment business as a Silicon Valley-bred streaming giant tries to swallow one of Hollywood’s oldest and most revered studios.

items.title: Musk’s X Fined as EU Escalates Free-Speech Clash With US
items.standfirst: Elon Musk’s X social network was slapped with a lower-than-expected €120 million ($140 million) fine for violating the European Union’s controversial content-moderation law, in a move still set to raise tensions with the White House over free speech and tech regulation.
items.content: Elon Musk’s X social network was slapped with a lower-than-expected €120 million ($140 million) fine for violating the European Union’s controversial content-moderation law, in a move still set to raise tensions with the White House over free speech and tech regulation.

ai_summary: Netflix announced an agreement to purchase Warner Bros. Discovery for $82.7 billion on Friday.
The deal merges the largest streaming service with a studio that produced iconic films.
Lawmakers, unions, and industry figures expressed concerns about the merger's impact.
The acquisition could reshape the global entertainment business landscape significantly.
Netflix outbid Paramount and Comcast in a competitive bidding process for Warner Bros.

items.standfirst: The US Supreme Court agreed on Friday to review US President Donald Trump's order on birthright citizenship. Several lower courts have previously blocked Trump's bid to restrict the law that states anyone born on US soil is automatically an American citizen.
items.content: The US Supreme Court agreed on Friday to review US President Donald Trump's order on birthright citizenship. Several lower courts have previously blocked Trump's bid to restrict the law that states anyone born on US soil is automatically an American citizen.

items.title: CDC advisory panel votes to limit hepatitis B vaccines for newborns
items.standfirst: Move from CDC advisers mirrors Trump team’s regressive approach to longstanding vaccine guidanceWho’s allowed to get the hepatitis B vaccine in the US now?Vaccine advisers for the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) voted on Friday morning to limit hepatitis B vaccines in a major move signaling the Trump administration’s regressive approach to vaccines that have been given safely and effectively for decades.The panel of advisers, hand-picked by the US health secretary, Robert F Kennedy Jr, decided to remove the well-established and far-reaching recommendation that all newborns in the US receive a hepatitis B vaccine. Continue reading...
items.content: Move from CDC advisers mirrors Trump team’s regressive approach to longstanding vaccine guidanceWho’s allowed to get the hepatitis B vaccine in the US now?Vaccine advisers for the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) voted on Friday morning to limit hepatitis B vaccines in a major move signaling the Trump administration’s regressive approach to vaccines that have been given safely and effectively for decades.The panel of advisers, hand-picked by the US health secretary, Robert F Kennedy Jr, decided to remove the well-established and far-reaching recommendation that all newborns in the US receive a hepatitis B vaccine. ai_summary: A CDC advisory panel voted to limit hepatitis B vaccines for newborns.
The panel members were appointed by Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr.
The panel removed the universal recommendation for newborn hepatitis B vaccination.
The decision has faced swift backlash from various groups and individuals.
The move reflects a shift in vaccine guidance by the Trump administration.
